a Feb. 3, 2003, National Security Council meeting in which Mr Colin Powell sketched out the presentation he was to make at the U.N. two days later. Mr Donald Rumsfeld quotes himself as telling the meeting, We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it. Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. a fictitious substance called`` red mercury'' that, according to local lore, can be found in the throats of ancient mummies. Some people think it has magical powers and can be used to summon spirits. They live thinking about it. They could kill each other to get it, Zahi Hawass said.`` When I enter any place in Egypt, people ask me all the time about this.''
